parameters: \pop[2]I wish with all of my heart that what I saw in The Wayfarer wasn't real.
\pop[2]But at the same time, with everything going on, it was too important to ignore.
\pop[2]In a state of anxiety, I hide in the plane, and wait for my friends to arrive.
\pop[2]Thankfully, there's plenty of snacks and drinks on the plane.
\pop[2]A bit stale, like Kyron mentioned, but satisfying nonetheless.
\pop[2]If we ever needed to \c[14]truly\c[0] hide, this would be our best bet.
\pop[2]I can't shake this feeling, though. I feel like I'm losing my mind.
\pop[2]Was I bottling everything up for so long that it's finally escaping?
\pop[2]No. It couldn't be. I'll talk with my friends, and they'll put my mind at ease.
\pop[4]Hey, Delta! Sorry to keep you waiting.
Figured I'd round everyone up and drive here together.
\pop[3]Can't believe he convinced me to get in that death-trap.
\pop[3]If your idea of a home is a torture chamber, sure.
Can't believe people used to drive around in things like that.
\pop[4]Like I keep saying, you'll thank me for having it one day.
\i[3]"For good reason. I saw an \c[23]Argus\c[0] agent."
\i[3]"For good reason. I saw an \c[23]Argus\c[0] agent."
\pop[4]You mean just minding their own business, right?
\i[3]"I saw them at The Wayfarer, when I picked up Dante's wallet."
\i[3]"I saw them at The Wayfarer, when I picked up Dante's wallet."
\pop[3]Oh, I'll take that back, by the way.
\pop[2]I nod, and toss him his wallet. He catches it with ease.
\i[3]"They were standing by the back door, staring at me."
\i[3]"They were standing by the back door, staring at me."
\pop[3]That doesn't mean they were after \c[14]us\c[0], though.
Maybe they realized someone snuck in there, and upped the security.
\i[3]"They stared directly at me, and held up an apple."
\i[3]"They stared directly at me, and held up an apple."
\pop[3]Yeah. They don't seem like the type to play mind games like this.
If they were on our trail, we'd already be locked up.
\pop[4]Don't they have bigger fish to fry...?
Kinda figured we were small-time compared to that.
\pop[2]I feel like they don't believe me...
\i[3]"Is it worth the risk to just disregard this?"
\i[3]"Is it worth the risk to just disregard this?"
It just feels like we're missing a piece of the puzzle.
\pop[3]Maybe they think we're caught up with \c[10]Hermes\c[0]...?
They could be gathering intel before they act.
\pop[3]You mean during the con next week?
\pop[4]If they want to abide by his timeline, yeah.
I really hope we're not caught in the crosshairs, here.
\pop[3]Call me paranoid, but I just \c[14]knew\c[0] something would happen.
\pop[3]They were probably on to us from the start...
\pop[4]You might. But I don't know about me.
I feel like I'll just get kicked out, and go back to my normal life.
\pop[3]You instill us with so much hope.
But you can't say I didn't warn you about this.
Remember, I told you about my vision. Still on the colony.
\pop[4]Has he actually told you what it is?
Or did you just take his word for it?
I don't really have a stake in all this business.
I'm only here to enjoy life in the city for as long as I can.
\pop[3]I won't even consider it an option.
\pop[2]Klace seems a bit lost in his diary. Scribbling notes once more.
\pop[3]That Isaac lied about his vision and lured us into a dangerous situation.
Or that he could be lying about any number of things he's said.
\pop[4]What are you writing in there, then?
\pop[4]Then you won't mind if I take a look?
\pop[2]Kyron walks toward Klace, like he's on a mission.
\pop[2]Almost immediately, however, Isaac blocks his path.
\pop[4]Kyron. Stop. That's not how things work around here.
In the city, we trust our friends, until they give us a reason not to.
\pop[3]I don't think we're being deceived, Kyron.
If we get in trouble, it's just because \c[14]we\c[0] slipped up.
\pop[4]You trust too easily. It's a recipe for disaster.
But I'm the odd one out, so I'll take your word for it.
\pop[2]I notice that Klace looks terrified, clutching his diary to his chest.
\pop[4]Everything is gonna be fine, I promise.
Delta, what you saw is alarming, but it's not \c[10]a death sentence\c[0].
\pop[4]We're still safe. we can keep it that way.
From this point on, we don't leave each other's sides.
\pop[3]Oooo, does that mean we get to sleep together, too?
\pop[4]If \c[14]Argus\c[0] is watching us, we \c[14]can't\c[0] split up anymore.
In fact, letting Delta go get your wallet was probably too risky.
\pop[2]He looks at Dante, who simply nods.
\pop[4]We'll just chill in your living room or something.
We'll all still be close by.
\pop[3]I like the sound of that, actually.
Makes me feel a lot more safe.
\pop[4]Then I get to come to The Quantum Leap?
Maybe hook me up with that group chat, too.
\pop[4]It seems like we don't really have a choice.
\pop[2]This is all happening so suddenly, but seeing that agent was sudden, too.
\pop[2]Sticking as close together as possible makes sense, at least in my head.
\pop[2]We could all be on the lookout, and we'd be a bit safer.
\pop[2]Reminds me of those dumb characters in horror movies that always split up.
\pop[2]It's a lot easier for the enemy to take us down one-by-one.
\pop[2]I also don't think that one of us is a traitor, or lying in any way.
\pop[2]But sticking together would eliminate the possibility of shady activity.
\pop[2]If we all kept tabs on one another, it'd be a lot harder to do anything malicious.
Just in case this agent thing is actually real.
\pop[4]I mean, I hate to say it, but we didn't see anything.
We just have Delta's word to go off of.
I've been on edge a lot lately too, you know?
Definitely thought I saw some stuff in the corner of my eye.
\i[3]"I did consider that it could all be in my head..."
\i[3]"I did consider that it could all be in my head..."
\pop[4]But that doesn't mean we shouldn't be cautious.
If anything, this can just push us toward a better overall plan.
\pop[4]Well, bathroom breaks, separate beds, and stuff like that.
We can still give each other alone time, just in different rooms.
The security in all of our houses is good enough to make that happen.
\pop[3]True. If anyone comes near my house, I'll know about it.
\pop[4]Mine, too. So those should be our safe spaces.
\pop[4]Could be risky. In our homes, at least we're in control.
I have no idea what's going on beneath the surface here.
\pop[4]If they could hear us in this plane, thing would've ended a \c[14]while\c[0] ago.
Remember, this is where you told us your "grand plan".
\pop[4]And remember who suggested that we come here?
\pop[4]Kyron, you need to stop pointing fingers.
We're all in this together, and we'll keep each other safe.
Besides, I know \c[23]Argus\c[0] will give in to \c[10]Cipher\c[0]'s demands.
\pop[4]You sound so certain, it's almost coming off as cocky.
\pop[4]That may be, but I really believe it.
And we can't get in trouble if this all goes our way.
Like I said, we'd just be ahead of the curve.
\pop[3]Then we just need to buy time until \c[10]Hermes\c[0]' deadline?
It's what we would've done, anyway.
Like I said, the security is top-notch.
You know how much I value my privacy.
\pop[3]Yeah, don't want those wild fans to come knocking.
\pop[4]We can talk more about it there.
This was all so haphazard, but I think it's a good start.
\pop[2]We all look at each other, and nod.
\pop[2]Even in this new situation, it feels like we're back to square one.
\pop[2]I just have to hope that this ends in the favor of the \c[10]zeros\c[0], and by extension, us.
\pop[2]Because if what we did is no longer "bad", then we'd be in the clear. I think...
\pop[2]But I remember some earlier discussions. That \c[23]Argus\c[0] may have already decided in secret.
\pop[2]If that's the case, and they're also watching us?
